string.name: gov_subsidy
string.br: The Government has been implemented the Public Transport Fare Subsidy Scheme on 1 January 2019. All commuters, regardless of their age and income levels, are not required to submit an application for the Scheme. Under the Scheme, commuters with monthly public transport expenses exceeding $400 are eligible for the public transport fare subsidy. The Government will provide a subsidy amounting to 25% of the actual monthly public transport expenses in excess of $400, subject to a maximum of $300 per month. The subsidy of each month will be calculated on the basis of the actual monthly public transport expenses recorded on each Octopus. \n

string.name: MTR_para1

Hong Kong's railways are run by the MTR Corporation and contains ten local lines, Airport Express (AEL), The Guangzhou-Shenzhen-Hong Kong Express Rail Link (Hong Kong Section) (XRL) and Light Rail. string.name: Minibus
string.br: Public Light Buses (PLBs) are minibuses with not more than 19 seats. Minibuses are used on scheduled services (green minibuses) and others on non-scheduled services (red minibuses). Red minibuses are free to operate anywhere, while Green minibuses operate one fixed routes.

string.name: About_Octopus
string.br: \n Octopus is an widely used electronic payment system in HK that eliminates the need to carry coins and cash. Octopus is now widely accepted by the transportation modes mentioned above as well as retail shops, online merchants, parking facilities, self-service kiosks, leisure facilities and schools. \n
Where can I get an octopus? \n

You can get a Standard Octopus or apply for a Personalised Octopus at MTR Customer Service Centres and customer service centres of public transport operators. For example, you can go to any customer service desk in the MTR. To first purchase the card a few of 50$ is necessary. However, this is a refundable deposit - Upon returning the card you will recieve these 50$ back \n
Can an octopus still be used even if there is not enough amount for the transaction? \n

If the remaining value on an Octopus is positive (HK$0.1 or more) but insufficient to cover the payment of a particular transaction, the Octopus can still be used as long as the resulting negative value does not exceed HK$35. The Octopus cannot be used if the remaining value is zero or negative prior to the transaction. \n
